entry.title: The Keynote Will NOT Go Forward
entry.content:
Due to concerns from the LGM community the planned keynote with Dr. Richard Stallman is cancelled.

<p>The <a href="/2025/news/2025-05-06_0002-keynote-announcement-richard-stallman">announcement</a> made many people angry and upset, and anger and division are not what LGM is about. Public debate was one of the factors that led to this decision. The discussion can be read here: <a href="https://post.lurk.org/@lgm/114462101041791903">Inital post on Mastodon</a>.</p> <p>LGM is committed to being an inclusive and safe venue for members of the Libre Graphics community, and we stand by the commitments to safety outlined by our <a href="/2025/code-of-conduct">Code of Conduct</a>.</p> <h2><a id="personal-note-of-the-organizer" class="heading_anchor" href="#personal-note-of-the-organizer" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Personal Note of the Organizer</h2> <p>I‚Äôll be welcoming everyone seeking a conversation with me about the topic.</p> <p>‚Äì Lasse</p>

entry.title: <s>Keynote Announcement: Dr. Richard Stallman</s>
entry.content:
<s>Wednesday, May 28th on the topic of: Free/Libre Software and Freedom in the Digital Society</s>

<p>This announcement is void, see <a href="/2025/news/2025-05-07_0001-keynote-will-not-go-forward">The Keynote Will NOT Go Forward.</a></p> <h2><a id="original-text" class="heading_anchor" href="#original-text" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Original Text</h2> <p>On Wednesday, May 28th at 19:30, <a href="/2025/hosts/Richard">Dr. Richard Stallman</a> will deliver a keynote on <a href="/2025/program/free-libre-software-and-freedom-in-the-digital-society/">Free/Libre Software and Freedom in the Digital Society</a> at Libre Graphics Meeting.</p> <h2><a id="admissiontickets" class="heading_anchor" href="#admissiontickets" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Admission/Tickets</h2> <p>Admission to the talk is free of charge at the registration desk when it opens on <strong>Wednesday</strong>, available on a first-come, first-served basis. There is no online registration for this; conference registrations remain separate. This ensures that general conference registrations remain available for those attending the full event.</p> <h2><a id="personal-note-of-the-organizer" class="heading_anchor" href="#personal-note-of-the-organizer" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Personal Note of the Organizer</h2> <p>I recognize that opinions on Richard Stallman‚Äôs presence vary, and I acknowledge the concerns some have expressed. Since announcing the keynote on the <a href="https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/libre-graphics-meeting/2025-May/002828.html">Libre Graphics Meeting mailing list</a> and through previous direct consultations, a pattern of remarks voicing concern over this decision has emerged. I‚Äôm trying to answer these briefly:</p> <h3><a id="remark-why-did-the-announcement-come-so-late" class="heading_anchor" href="#remark-why-did-the-announcement-come-so-late" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Remark: Why did the announcement come so late?</h3> <p>My time is limited. Up until the <a href="https://atypi.org/presentation/parametric-typography-with-parametric-fonts/">ATypI Copenhagen</a> conference I had a double load of work: my regular work and organizing the LGM. I‚Äôm now working on catching up up on LGM tasks.</p> <h3><a id="remark-richard-stallman-is-controversial" class="heading_anchor" href="#remark-richard-stallman-is-controversial" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Remark: Richard Stallman is controversial.</h3> <p>There have been attacks against him; in the meantime, <a href="https://stallmansupport.org/">stallmansupport.org</a> has provided a defense. After reviewing the complaints and the defense, I concluded that the concerns lacked substantive weight.</p> <h3><a id="remark-lack-of-relevance-especially-for-the-graphics-in-libre-graphics-meeting" class="heading_anchor" href="#remark-lack-of-relevance-especially-for-the-graphics-in-libre-graphics-meeting" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Remark: Lack of relevance, especially for the ‚Äúgraphics‚Äù in Libre Graphics Meeting.</h3> <p>His work is relevant to me every day in Libre Graphics. I understand that this may not be universally shared, but I know others who see it similarly. Even if his contributions aren‚Äôt directly tied to the ‚Äúgraphics‚Äù in Libre Graphics Meeting, I hope we can at least use him as a lens on the past to inspire ideas for the future.</p> <h3><a id="concluding" class="heading_anchor" href="#concluding" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Concluding</h3> <p>I hope we can have a conference that is welcoming to everyone and that discussion and participation, rather than shunning and avoidance, will make our community grow together.</p> <p>‚Äì Lasse</p>

entry.title: Call for Slides: State of Libre Graphics
entry.content:
Please submit your slides for the State of Libre Graphics presentation!

<p>The opening presentation at Libre Graphics Meeting is <a href="/2025/program/state_of_libre_graphics/">‚ÄúState of Libre Graphics,‚Äù</a> an update from the many software, curation, publication and umbrella projects of our Libre Graphics community.</p> <h2><a id="contribute" class="heading_anchor" href="#contribute" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Contribute</h2> <p>Find all the details on how to contribute in the <a href="https://github.com/libregraphicsmeeting/state-of-lg-2025">README of the libregraphicsmeeting/state-of-lg-2025 Repository</a>.</p> <h2><a id="share" class="heading_anchor" href="#share" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Share</h2> <p>Please forward this message to projects that you think should contribute.</p>

entry.title: Revive the 'State of Libre Graphics'
entry.content:
Looking for someone or a group to organize and host the 'State of Libre Graphics' presentation at LGM!

<p>It‚Äôs a classic tradition and would be great to revive this year. Scheduled right after the opening on Wednesday, 20 minutes (with the option to extend a bit). Perfect for remote prep + local contribution.</p> <ul> <li><a href="/2025/program/state_of_libre_graphics/">Program item</a></li> <li>We‚Äôll set up a GitHub repo like 2019‚Äôs: <a href="https://github.com/libregraphicsmeeting/state-of-lg-2019">github.com/libregraphicsmeeting/state-of-lg-2019</a></li> <li>Call for contributions will be similar to the <a href="/2016/state-of-libre-graphics-union-2016/">2016 format</a>, but if you‚Äôre taking this on, feel free to organize differently!</li> </ul> <p>I can‚Äôt take this on myself‚Äîalready stretched thin‚Äîbut this would be a fantastic effort. Who‚Äôs in? üòä</p> <p>‚Äî Lasse</p>

entry.title: LGM will be streamed and recorded
entry.content:
Nothing can beat meeting in person, but the second best thing is live streams and recordings.

<p>We are more than excited to be <a href="/2025/partners/#live-streaming-and-video-recording">partnering</a> with <a href="https://chaoswest.tv/">Chaos-West TV</a> to broadcast the LGM live online and to capture the sessions on video for later viewing via <a href="https://media.ccc.de/">media.ccc.de</a>.</p> <div class="partner"> <a class="partner-logo" href="https://chaoswest.tv/"><img src="/2025/img/partners/chaos-west-tv_logo.svg" alt="Logo Sponsor: Chaos-West TV" /></a> <span class="partner-info"><a class="partner-link" href="https://chaoswest.tv/">Chaos-West TV</a></span> </div> <p>While you can stay at home and enjoy the spectacle from afar, our speakers will have to travel to get into the focus of our cameras. To ease their effort we are organizing a <a href="/2025/reimbursement/">reimbursement program</a>.</p> <p>If you‚Äôd like to help make this possible, please consider <a href="/2025/donate">donating</a>. Your support makes all the difference‚Äîthank you!</p> <div class="call_for_action"> <a href="https://www.ulule.com/lgm25nbg/">Donate Here</a><br /> We use ulule.com as the donations system. </div>

entry.title: Program public, Registrations open, Donate!
entry.content:
We are thrilled to announce that the program for this year's Libre Graphics Meeting is now public!

<p>This event promises to be a diverse and colorful showcase of our incredible community‚Äôs talent, creativity, and dedication.</p> <p>Join us in celebrating libre graphics in all its breadth and depth. We can‚Äôt wait to see you in Nuremberg and share in the excitement of this year‚Äôs meeting!</p> <h2><a id="key-actions" class="heading_anchor" href="#key-actions" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Key Actions</h2> <ol> <li>Read our <a href="/2025/program">Program</a>,</li> <li>if you plan to attend, please <a href="/2025/register">Register!</a> yourself,</li> <li>and consider to <a href="/2025/donate">Donate!</a>.</li> </ol>

entry.title: The Call for Participation has concluded.
entry.content:
Some slots will still be available. Read here about our next steps.

<p><strong>Thank you all for your submissions.</strong> We can already announce that all proposals will be accepted. We will send notice to all individual submitters within the coming week.</p> <h2><a id="transparency" class="heading_anchor" href="#transparency" aria-hidden="true">#</a>Transparency</h2> <p>So far, we‚Äôll have 19 presentations and 11 BoFs or Workshops. However, we can presumably fit some more contributions into the schedule; there might be a chance for latecomers to have their proposals included.</p> <p>If you missed the initial deadline, we invite you to submit your proposals now. Please read the <a href="/2025/call-for-participation">Call for Participation</a>. Details about the process are explaine below.</p> <h2><a id="whats-next" class="heading_anchor" href="#whats-next" aria-hidden="true">#</a>What‚Äôs next?</h2> <p>We will be crafting a preliminary program soon; this will also help us determine the required premises and the booking of these. Once that‚Äôs in place, we will publish the initial program and announce any remaining free slots for further contributions. New submissions will be accepted on a first-come, first-served basis, so don‚Äôt hesitate!</p>

entry.title: Libre Graphics Meeting 2025
entry.content:
The 18th annual Libre Graphics Meeting (LGM) will be held in Nuremberg, Germany on May 28-31, 2025.

<p>The Libre Graphics Meeting is an annual meeting on Free/Libre and Open Source software for graphics. For now, please see the <a href="/2025/call-for-participation">Call for Participation</a>, <strong>read it, share it and spread the word!</strong></p> <blockquote> <p>Thank you!</p> </blockquote>
